mp_game_engine module

mp_game_engine.ai_opponent_game_loop() → None[source]

Fully functional player vs AI game loop on the command-line

mp_game_engine.generate_attack(board_size: int = 10, algorithm: str = 'random') → tuple[int, int][source]

Generates AI attack coordinates based on algorithm

Parameters:

  • board_size (int, optional) – Size of board, defaults to 10

  • algorithm (str, optional) – Algorithm used, defaults to “random”

Raises:

ValueError – When algorithm does not match any defined algorithms

Returns:

Tuple int pair representing x and y coordinates of AI’s turn

Return type:

Coordinates

mp_game_engine.print_board(board: list[list[str | None]], board_history: dict[tuple[int, int], bool], show_ships: bool = True) → None[source]

Prints an ASCII representation of the board’s state with grid headings

Parameters:

  • board (Board) – Board to display

  • board_history (dict[Coordinates, bool]) – Coordinates:bool pair to track attacked cell colour

  • show_ships (bool, optional) – Show or hide ships not yet revealed in board_history, defaults to True

mp_game_engine.random_attack_algorithm(board_size: int) → tuple[int, int][source]

Generates random x and y coordinates within range of given board_size

Parameters:

board_size (int) – Range for random number generator

Returns:

Tuple of random int pair representing x and y coordinates

Return type:

Coordinates
